job_title: Charity Shop Manager in Wythenshawe, England
pros: really wonderful charity to work for, they really care about their staff and all the people they help through their charity work, the area manager is always available if you need any help or advice.

job_title: Volunteer in Bury, East of England, England
cons: Pressure all the time, manager grumpy

job_title: Head of International Programmes in London, England
pros: Flexible and fully remote working, trusted charity Doing great work

job_title: Volunteer in Newcastle upon Tyne, England
pros: Amazing staff and you get to know the regular customers
cons: Can be over worked at times

job_title: Finance Officer in Leeds, South East England, England
pros: Excellent work culture. Good work life balance
cons: Infrastructure not the best. Could improve on

review_title: Low pay with expectation to go extra mile
job_title: Young Vincentian Administrator in London, England
pros: Nice team who are friendly, sociable and care about individuals and wellbeing.  Employee assistance programme. Nice working environment sharing the office with CAFOD who have social activities which SVP can participate in at lunchtime.
cons: Low pay.  Not much support as tends to be one person per role. Working overtime is common  which one can only take back as TOIL for specific reasons and is often not recompensed. The expectation is to go the extra mile.
